CAN: The student may be able to depict ice and water as separate entities but without clear transformation stages (simple drawings of a block and a puddle).
The student might attempt to show the ice and the water as two distinct items.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to illustrate the characteristics of ice correctly as a solid or water as a liquid in detail (minimal differentiation between the two).
The student might not depict the process of melting or freezing correctly (missing or incorrect transition depiction).
The student may not label the drawings accurately to show the reversible nature of the changes (might label them but not relate to changes).
The student is unlikely to connect the drawings to the concept of reversible and irreversible changes (concept may be entirely absent or misunderstood).
